WHAT DID EARLY CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and send it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.

Name Mrs. P.P. Foster
Address R.R. No. 2, S.A., Saskatchewan
Birthplace Massena, N.Y., Que.

1. HOUSEHOLD QUESTIONS
What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1905
Where did you set up housekeeping? 16-31-18, Rd. 3rd
Where had you been living before that? Massena, N.Y., Que.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 4
How far was it to your nearest store? 100 miles (Saskatoon)
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice first summer
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Usual run of groceries in bulk.

19. Have you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

   No.
Dear Mrs. Foster,

I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to express my gratitude for your kind invitation to join us for dinner next weekend. It is always a pleasure to spend time with you and your family.

This weekend promises to be quite special as we celebrate Thanksgiving together. I have prepared a menu that I believe will suit everyone's tastes:

- **Main Course:** Turkey Roast
- **Side Dishes:** Mashed Potatoes, Green Beans, Cranberry Sauce
- **Dessert:** Pumpkin Pie

Please let me know if there are any dietary restrictions or preferences you should be aware of. I look forward to seeing you and your family soon.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
